page.title: 02ST.ANNE'S ANGLICAN CHURCH
page.content: The present church was built in 1853 and an old church was knocked down.At that time a bigger church was needed, but now only about 20 people attend each service.Services are every Sunday morning with about five special services every year.23% of those asked claimed to attend St Anne's regularly. Local people clean the church voluntarily.A local lady plays the organ and the bell is rung by an early riser!There are only a few marriages, christenings and funerals annually.In March 1982 people started collecting money for roof repairs.In January 1984 part of the roof fell in and so work had to begin.The back pews were removed,part of the floor lowered,the ceilings were insulated and boarded. The West wall has been waterproofed and the door restored.A new door, sponsored by BNFL,was put on the porch
